[[Politician]] | signature = | signature_alt = | module = {{Infobox football biography | embed = yes | header-color = lavender | position = [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|Centre back]], [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left back]] | years1 = 1993–1998 |clubs1 = [[FC Dinamo Tbilisi|Dinamo Tbilisi]] |caps1 = 82 |goals1 = 1 | years2 = 1998–2001 |clubs2 = [[FC Dynamo Kyiv|Dynamo Kyiv]] |caps2 = 71 |goals2 = 6 | years3 = 2001–2010 |clubs3 = [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] |caps3 = 194 |goals3 = 12 | years4 = 2010–2012 |clubs4 = [[Genoa C.F.C.|Genoa]] |caps4 = 53 |goals4 = 1 | totalcaps = 400 | totalgoals = 20 | nationalyears1 = 1993–1994 | nationalyears2 = 1995 | nationalyears3 = 1995–1996 | nationalyears4 = 1996–2011 | nationalteam1 = [[Georgia national under-17 football team|Georgia U17]] | nationalteam2 = [[Georgia national under-19 football team|Georgia U19]] | nationalteam3 = [[Georgia national under-21 football team|Georgia U21]] | nationalteam4 = [[Georgia national football team|Georgia]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalcaps4 = 83 | nationalgoals4 = 1 }} }} '''Kakhaber "Kakha" Kaladze''' ({{lang-ka|კახაბერ (კახა) კალაძე}} {{IPA-ka|kʼaxabɛr kʼalad͡zɛ|}}; born 27 February 1978) is a [[Georgia (country)|Georgian]] politician and retired [[Association football|footballer]]. He has served as a [[Mayor of Tbilisi]] since November 2017. A versatile player, he was capable of playing both as a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre-back]] and as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left-back]],{{cite news|last=May|first=John|title=AC Milan Pen Pics|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/europe/6658701.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=7 January 2013|date=22 May 2007}} or even as a [[Midfielder#Winger|wide midfielder]].{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/champions-league-final-how-the-old-trafford-teams-shape-up-591267.html|title=Champions' League final: How the old trafford teams shape up|publisher=The Independent|date=27 May 2003|accessdate=6 March 2017}} He played for the [[Georgia national football team|Georgia national team]] from 1996 to 2011. He was voted [[Georgian Footballer of the Year]] in 2001–2003, and 2006{{cite news|url=http://news.sport-express.ru/2006-06-09/141288|script-title=ru:Каладзе в четвертый раз признан лучшим футболистом Грузии| publisher=Sport-express.ru| language=Russian|date=2006-06-09|accessdate=2009-06-28}} and was considered as one of Georgia's most important players.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/2319225.stm|title=Georgia clashes with Russia – in football|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2002-10-11|accessdate=2009-08-18}} Kaladze started his football career in 1993 at [[Umaglesi Liga]] club [[FC Dinamo Tbilisi|Dinamo Tbilisi]] and made 82 appearances in a five-year spell. In 1998, he moved to the [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] club [[FC Dynamo Kyiv|Dynamo Kyiv]] and made 71 appearances until 2001, when he was signed by the Italian [[Serie A]] club [[A.C. Milan|Milan]]. He has won one Serie A, three [[Ukrainian Premier League]] and five Umaglesi Liga titles. With Milan, he won the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] on two occasions, the [[UEFA Super Cup]] once and the [[FIFA Club World Cup]] once. After captaining his country 50 times in 84 appearances, Kaladze announced his retirement from the Georgian national team on 11 December 2011.{{cite news|url=http://www.civil.ge/eng/article.php?id=24258|title=Ivanishvili Launches Public Movement|publisher=[[Civil Georgia]]|date=2011-12-11|accessdate=2011-12-17}}{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/news/newsid=1732967.html|title=Georgia captain Kaladze announces retirement|publisher=UEFA.com|date=2011-12-12|accessdate=2011-12-17}} Born in [[Samtredia]], a town in [[Imereti|Imereti Province]], Kaladze comes from a footballing family as his father played for [[FC Samtredia|Lokomotiv Samtredia]] and was also president of the team for some time. His brother was kidnapped in a high-profile case in 2001 and officially declared dead in 2006, resulting in two men being sentenced to [[prison]] for a combined total of 30 years. Outside of football, he owns a company called Kala Capital and an organisation called Kala Foundation, as well as being an ambassador for [[SOS Children's Villages]]. He is married to Anouki Areshidze, with whom he has three children. Kaladze became involved in the politics of Georgia as a member of the opposition [[Georgian Dream–Democratic Georgia]] party, founded by [[Bidzina Ivanishvili]] in February 2012. He was elected to the [[Parliament of Georgia]] on 1 October 2012 and approved as Deputy Prime Minister as well as [[Ministry of Energy (Georgia)|Minister of Energy]] in [[cabinet of Bidzina Ivanishvili|Ivanishvili's cabinet]] on 25 October 2012.{{cite news|title=Ivanishvili Confirmed as Prime Minister|url=http://civil.ge/eng/article.php?id=25389|accessdate=25 October 2012|newspaper=Civil Georgia|date=25 October 2012}} He continued to occupy both of these position under the [[Second Cabinet of Giorgi Kvirikashvili|succeeding cabinet]] of [[Giorgi Kvirikashvili]] until July 2017, when he resigned to run for the [[Mayor of Tbilisi]] as a Georgian Dream candidate in the October 2017 [[Georgian local elections, 2017|election]],{{cite news|title=New Energy Minister, Deputy PM Appointed|url=http://civil.ge/eng/article.php?id=30257|accessdate=26 August 2017|work=Civil Georgia|date=12 July 2017}} which he won with 51.13%. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Kaladze started his career playing as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] for his local club [[FC Samtredia|Lokomotiv Samtredia]], where his father was president, until former Georgia international footballer [[David Kipiani]] requested Kakha to join [[FC Dinamo Tbilisi|Dinamo Tbilisi]]. At Dinamo, he played in 82 domestic league games and scored one goal.{{cite news|url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/football/kakha-kaladze.html|title=Eurosport – Kakha Kaladze|publisher=Eurosport|accessdate=2009-06-28}} He made his top-flight debut as a 16-year-old with Dinamo during the [[1993–94 Umaglesi Liga|1993–94 campaign]].{{cite news|url=http://www.footballdatabase.com/index.php?page=player&Id=796&pn=Kakhaber_Kaladze|title=Football Database profile|publisher=Football Database|accessdate=2009-08-09}} Kaladze claims that a good performance against [[Italy national football team|Italy]] while playing for Georgia in a match that ended 0–0 brought him to the attention of [[FC Dynamo Kyiv|Dynamo Kyiv]]; he later said, "In that game I was up against [[Christian Vieri]] and I [[Man-to-man marking|marked]] him well." A fee equivalent to €280,000 was enough to take him to the [[Ukrainian Premier League]] and Dynamo Kiev in January 1998,{{cite news|url=http://stats.sports.theglobeandmail.com/seri/players.asp?player=16975|title=No.4 Kakhaber Kaladze|publisher=''Globe and Mail''|accessdate=2009-08-12}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}} where he signed a four-year deal.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/europe/1134373.stm|title=AC Milan sign Kaladze|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2001-01-24|accessdate=2009-08-18}} Here he scored six goals in 71 league games over the two-and-a-half seasons he spent there. The Ukrainian club had been under the ownership of [[Hryhoriy Surkis]] and the late [[Valeriy Lobanovskyi]] had just been installed as [[Coach (sport)|manager]]; they would go on to win eight consecutive league titles.{{cite news|url=http://www.fcdynamo.kiev.ua/en/history/period5/5330.html|title=FC Dynamo Kyiv – 1992–2006|publisher=FC Dynamo Kyiv|accessdate=2009-08-18|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080505070827/http://www.fcdynamo.kiev.ua/en/history/period5/5330.html|archivedate=2008-05-05}} Kaladze also appeared in [[Two-legged tie|both legs]] of the semi-final of the [[1998–99 UEFA Champions League|1998–99 Champions League]] against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]], which Dynamo Kyiv lost 4–3 on aggregate.{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football-jancker-seals-bayern-comeback-1085908.html|title=Jancker seals Bayern comeback|publisher=''The Independent''|date=2009-04-08|accessdate=2009-08-08|author=Yuri Kozak | location=London}}{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football-baslers-wonder-goal-takes-bayern-to-barcelona-1088886.html|title=Basler's wonder goal takes Bayern to Barcelona|publisher=''The Independent''|date=2009-04-22|accessdate=2009-08-08|author=Andrew Warshaw | location=London}} En route to the semi-finals, they beat teams like [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] and [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]. He won eight league titles in a row during his time at both Dinamo Tbilisi and Dynamo Kyiv.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2006/apr/16/championsleague|title=Kaladze fighting his grief in Milan defence|publisher=''The Observer''|author=Amy Lawrence|date=2006-04-16|accessdate=2009-06-29 | location=London}} ===A.C. Milan=== In 2001, Kaladze became the most expensive Georgian footballer in history when [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] paid €16 million to bring him to Italy. He cited an injury to [[Aleksei Gerasimenko]] as his reason for leaving.{{cite news|url=http://www.worldsoccer.com/news/kakha_kaladze_news_55742.html|title=World Soccer – Kakha Kaladze|publisher=''World Soccer''|date=2003-09-02|accessdate=2009-06-28}} At first, Kaladze was tried in different positions and faced competition for places in defense from players such as [[Jaap Stam]] and [[Cafu]]. In the [[2002–03 Serie A|2002–03 season]], however, he made 46 appearances in all competitions, including 27 [[Serie A]] appearances.{{cite web|url=http://www.acmilan.com/en/archive/roster_player/42/15|title=Kakha Kaladze – A.C. Milan profile|publisher=A.C. Milan|accessdate=2012-01-05}} That year, Milan won the [[UEFA Champions League 2002–03|Champions League]], where they beat [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] on [[Penalty shootout (association football)|penalties]] in the [[2003 UEFA Champions League Final|final]] (despite Kaladze missing his penalty){{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/champions_league/2934840.stm|title=Milan win Champions League shoot-out|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2003-05-28|accessdate=2009-07-08}} and the [[Coppa Italia 2002–03|Coppa Italia]], where they beat [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] 6–3 on [[Two-legged tie|aggregate]] in the final.{{cite news|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tablesi/italcup03.html|title=Italy Cup 2002/03|publisher=RSSSF|accessdate=2009-07-08}} After Kaladze's [[Double (association football)|double]] success, the Georgian postal service issued a special [[Postage stamp|stamp]] bearing the player's image.{{cite news|url=http://sports.espn.go.com/espnmag/story?id=3544115|title=The World's Game (according to us)|publisher=ESPN|author=Austin Kelley|accessdate=2009-06-29}} He is the first Georgian player to win a Champions League title.{{cite news|url=http://www.la84foundation.org/SportsLibrary/SoccerAmerica/2003/sa1554z.pdf|title=Milan reigns again as European champion|publisher=Soccer America|author=Paul Kennedy|accessdate=2009-07-08}} {{Quote box|width=30%|align=left|quote= "I've always dreamed of playing for a top club abroad, but I could have stayed at Kyiv, picked up an injury and it would all have been over for me. That's why I asked Dynamo president Hryhorii Surkis to put me on the transfer list."|source='''Kakha Kaladze''', upon leaving Dynamo Kyiv in relation to Gerasimenko's injury.}} Kaladze was limited to just six league appearances and 11 total appearances in the [[2003–04 Serie A|2003–04 season]]. In the [[2004–05 Serie A|next season]], Kaladze played just 19 Serie A matches and five in the Champions League as Milan finished as runners-up in both competitions. He was an unused [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in that season's [[2005 UEFA Champions League Final|Champions League final]], where Milan lost on penalties to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] after a 3–3 draw.{{cite news|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=183634&cc=5739|title=Milan 3–3 Liverpool: Penalty drama|publisher=ESPN|date=2005-05-25|accessdate=2009-08-11}} He was said to be frustrated with his lack of first-team options and a move to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], in exchange for [[Hernán Crespo]] or for £4 million,{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/4076340.stm|title=Kaladze ready for Chelsea talks|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2005-06-14|accessdate=2009-08-18}} was widely reported.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-350800/Kaladze-Chelsea-possible--Milan.html|title=Kaladze move to Chelsea possible – Milan|publisher=''Daily Mail''|date=2005-06-02|accessdate=2009-08-11}}{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/article528279.ece|title=Chelsea may swap Crespo for Kaladze|work=Times Online|date=2005-06-02|accessdate=2009-08-11 | location=London | first=Gabriele | last=Marcotti}} Kaladze himself said, "I have agreed everything with the Chelsea management. Now it is necessary to wait for them to reach an agreement with Milan and I think I could become a Chelsea player next week."{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/kaladze-happy-to-be-part-of-crespo-deal-with-chelsea-493493.html|title=Kaladze happy to be part of Crespo deal with Chelsea|publisher=''The Independent''|author=Zaza Tsuladze|date=2005-06-09|accessdate=2009-08-11|location=London|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091012110036/http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/kaladze-happy-to-be-part-of-crespo-deal-with-chelsea-493493.html|archivedate=2009-10-12}} Chelsea opted to sign [[Asier del Horno]] instead and Kaladze later declared himself "glad" that the deal fell through.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-456650/Kaladze-glad-missed-Chelsea-move.html|title=Kaladze so glad to have missed out on Chelsea move|publisher=''Daily Mail''|date=2007-05-21|accessdate=2009-08-11}} On 30 June 2005, he extended his contract with Milan until 2010{{cite news|url=http://www1.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=313332.html|title=Kaladze 'very happy' with Milan deal|date=30 June 2005|accessdate=4 July 2010|publisher=UEFA.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111005183047/http://www1.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid%3D313332.html|archivedate=5 October 2011|df=dmy-all}} and again on 4 September 2006, this time until 2011.{{cite news|url=http://en.geofootball.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=89:kaladze-stays-in-milan&catid=18&Itemid=100007|title=Kaladze Stays in Milan|publisher=Geofootball.com|date=2006-09-04|accessdate=2009-08-13|author=Teimuraz Gogodze|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711084818/http://en.geofootball.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=89:kaladze-stays-in-milan&catid=18&Itemid=100007|archive-date=11 July 2011|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=http://www.acmilan.com/it/news/show/47701|title=Georgiano e rossonero|date=29 May 2007|accessdate=4 July 2010|work=A.C. Milan|language=Italian}} In [[2005–06 Serie A|2005–06]], an injury to [[Paolo Maldini]] meant that Kaladze was moved back into the centre of defence, his favoured position. Milan finished third that season, although they would have finished second if there were no [[2006 Italian football scandal]] which resulted in a 30-point deduction.{{cite news|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tablesi/ital06.html|title=Italy 2005/06|publisher=RSSSF|accessdate=2009-08-11}} In the [[2006–07 Serie A|2006–07 Serie A campaign]], Kaladze scored a goal against [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]] which turned out to be his only goal of the season. Milan finished in fourth place with an eight-point deduction relating to the previous season's scandal.{{cite news|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tablesi/ital07.html|title=Italy 2006/07|publisher=RSSSF|accessdate=2009-08-13}} Kaladze won his second Champions League title on 23 May 2007 after Milan beat Liverpool 2–1 in the [[2007 UEFA Champions League Final|final]]; he came on as a 79th-minute substitute in that match.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/europe/6669039.stm|title=AC Milan 2–1 Liverpool|publisher=BBC Sport|author=Phil McNulty|date=2007-05-23|accessdate=2009-06-29}} He later picked up the [[FIFA Club World Cup]] in December that year where Milan beat [[Boca Juniors]] 4–2 in the [[2007 FIFA Club World Cup|final]], though Kaladze was one of two players to be [[sent off]] in that match.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/7145975.stm|title=AC Milan 4–2 Boca Juniors|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2007-12-16|accessdate=2009-06-29}} He had established himself as a first-team regular in the [[2007–08 Serie A|2007–08 season]], making 32 appearances, but had only featured sparingly in the [[2008–09 Serie A|2008–09 season]] due to a [[knee]] [[ligament]] injury sustained in a [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup]] match against [[FC Zürich|Zürich]].{{cite news|url=http://en.geofootball.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=387:kaladze-faces-long-lay-off&catid=18&Itemid=100007|title=Kaladze faces long lay-off|publisher=Geofootball.com|author=Sandro Gagua|date=2008-10-03|accessdate=2009-08-13|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081211144610/http://en.geofootball.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=387:kaladze-faces-long-lay-off&catid=18&Itemid=100007|archive-date=11 December 2008|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/8/main/2009/03/18/1162235/injuries-have-cost-milan-the-scudetto--kaladze|title=Injuries Have Cost Milan The Scudetto – Kaladze|publisher=Goal.com|author=Salvatore Landolina|date=2009-03-18|accessdate=2009-06-29}} Kaladze's performance in the 15 February 2009 [[Derby della Madonnina|Milan derby]] was described as a "horror show" on the [[Channel 4]] website which started a dispute over an alleged [[smear campaign]] between Kaladze and the Georgian newspaper ''Lelo'', who used the quote, "Milan really does need a new centre-back after Kakha Kaladze’s horror show in the derby."{{cite news|url=http://www.channel4.com/sport/football_italia/sa0809/week24thatwas.html|title=What we learned this week|publisher=Channel 4|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090524173115/http://channel4.com/sport/football_italia/sa0809/week24thatwas.html|archivedate=24 May 2009|author=Antonio Labbate|accessdate=2009-07-08}}{{cite news|url=http://www.geotimes.ge/index.php?m=home&newsid=15435|title=I would not get into arguments with a journalist who criticized me|publisher=''Georgian Times''|author=Eka Bilanishvili|date=2009-03-03|accessdate=2009-07-08|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101030045235/http://geotimes.ge/index.php?m=home&newsid=15435|archivedate=30 October 2010|df=dmy-all}} Milan finished third in the league that season, ten points behind Serie A champions [[Inter Milan]]; Kaladze believed this was caused by the many injuries suffered by the Milan squad. ===Genoa=== On 31 August 2010, Kaladze signed with [[Genoa C.F.C.|Genoa]];{{cite news |title=Preso Kaladze a titolo definitivo |url=http://www.genoacfc.it/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=10410&Itemid=31 |work=genoacfc.it |publisher=[[Genoa C.F.C.|Genoa Cricket and Football Club]] |date=31 August 2010 |accessdate=31 August 2010 |language=Italian}} Milan later revealed that it was a free transfer.{{cite web|url=http://www.acmilan.com/uploads/club/bilancio2010/pdf/Bilancio_Gruppo_Milan_10.pdf |title=Relazioni e bilancio al 31 Dicembre 2010 gruppo Milan |publisher=A.C. Milan |accessdate=2011-07-16 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120515220657/http://www.acmilan.com/uploads/club/bilancio2010/pdf/Bilancio_Gruppo_Milan_10.pdf |archivedate=15 May 2012 |df= }} In the [[2010–11 Serie A|2010–11 season]], he played 26 matches and scored one goal, which came against [[S.S.D. Parma Calcio 1913|Parma]] on 30 January 2011.{{cite news |title=Genoa vs. Parma 3–1 |url= https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2011/01/30/italy/serie-a/genoa-cfc/parma-fc/990166/ |work=soccerway.com |publisher=Soccerway |date=30 January 2011 |accessdate=17 May 2011}} He was named as second-best defender of the 2010–11 Serie A by ''[[La Gazzetta dello Sport]]'', being surpassed only by his former teammate, Milan's [[Thiago Silva]].{{cite news |title=Kaladze Is in the Second Place among Serie A Defenders|url=http://worldsport.ge/Read.aspx?lang=2&news=20911 |work=worldsport.ge|publisher=Worldsport|date=30 May 2011 |accessdate=3 June 2011}} On 12 May 2012, Kaladze announced his retirement from football.{{cite news |title=Genoa's Kakha Kaladze announces retirement from football|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/10/italy/2012/05/12/3097741/genoas-kakha-kaladze-announces-retirement-from-football |work=Goal.com|publisher=Goal.com|date=12 May 2012 |accessdate=25 May 2012}} ==International career== Kaladze won his first [[Cap (sport)|cap]] against [[Cyprus national football team|Cyprus]] in a [[Exhibition match|friendly match]] on 27 March 1996,{{cite news|url=http://www.rsssf.com/intldetails/1996e2.html|title=1996 International matches|publisher=RSSSF|accessdate=2009-06-28}} coming on as a 72nd-minute substitute for [[Mikhail Kavelashvili]].{{cite news|url=http://eu-football.info/_player.php?id=10020|title=Kakha Kaladze – profile|publisher=European Football|accessdate=2012-01-05}} Later that year, he was sent off for the first time in his international career against [[Lebanon national football team|Lebanon]] in a friendly match. He subsequently featured in his country's qualifying campaigns for the [[1998 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|1998]], [[2002 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2002]], [[2006 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2006]] and [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2010 FIFA World Cups]], and the [[UEFA Euro 2000 qualifying|2000]], [[UEFA Euro 2004 qualifying|2004]] and [[UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying|2008 UEFA European Championships]]. Georgia, however, have never qualified for the [[FIFA World Cup]] or the [[UEFA European Football Championship|UEFA European Championship]] since they split from the [[Soviet Union national football team|Soviet Union]].{{cite news|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tablesg/geor-intres.html|title=Georgia – International Results|publisher=RSSSF|accessdate=2009-08-14}} His competitive debut was against [[Poland national football team|Poland]] on 14 June 1997 in a 1998 World Cup qualifier; Georgia lost the match 4–1. Just two matches later, Kaladze was sent off for the second time playing for Georgia, along with [[Georgi Kinkladze]], against [[Moldova national football team|Moldova]] in another 1998 World Cup qualifier. Georgia finished in fourth place in the group and failed to qualify.{{cite news|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tables/98q.html|title=World Cup 1998 Qualifying|publisher=RSSSF|accessdate=2009-08-14}} In qualifying for [[UEFA Euro 2000|Euro 2000]], Georgia finished at the bottom of the group ([[UEFA Euro 2000 qualifying Group 2|Group 2]]) in sixth place, with just one win.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/sport/football/191195.stm|title=Football Euro 2000 qualifying group tables|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2009-08-14 | date=1999-10-10}} Kaladze occasionally captained the side during these qualifiers in the absence of [[Georgi Nemsadze]]. The qualifiers for the [[2002 FIFA World Cup|2002 World Cup]] ended with Georgia finishing in third place, ahead of [[Hungary national football team|Hungary]] and [[Lithuania national football team|Lithuania]].{{cite news|url=http://www.worldcup-2002.co.uk/qualifying-UEFA.htm|title=2002 FIFA World Cup – UEFA Qualifying Results|publisher=World Cup 2002|accessdate=2009-08-14|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090627023435/http://www.worldcup-2002.co.uk/qualifying-UEFA.htm|archivedate=27 June 2009|df=dmy-all}} Kaladze played in all of the matches and often missed the friendlies in between. Kaladze only played in three matches during the [[UEFA Euro 2004|Euro 2004]] qualifiers, where Georgia finished in last place in the group.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/internationals/2899307.stm|title=Euro 2004 Qualifying Group Ten|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2003-10-11|accessdate=2009-08-14}} He did, however, feature in a 1–0 victory over neighbouring [[Russia national football team|Russia]], a victory considered to be one of Georgia's greatest successes.{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/mm/goalproject/geo_eng.pdf|title=Goal Project – Georgia|publisher=FIFA|date=2009-01-20|accessdate=2009-08-17}} Kaladze played in all but one of the [[2006 FIFA World Cup|2006 World Cup]] qualifying matches, where Georgia finished sixth in the group, with [[Kazakhstan national football team|Kazakhstan]] being the only team to finish below them.{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/archive/germany2006/preliminaries/preliminary=8071/index.html |title=2006 FIFA World Cup Germany Preliminaries |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=2009-08-16 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140112182108/http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/archive/germany2006/preliminaries/preliminary%3D8071/index.html |archivedate=12 January 2014 |df= }} He played fewer matches during the qualification for [[UEFA Euro 2008|Euro 2008]] and once again Georgia failed to qualify as they finished in sixth place despite starting their campaign with a 6–0 win over the [[Faroe Islands national football team|Faroe Islands]].{{cite news|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/group?league=uefa.euroq&season=2008&seasonType=1&groupId=2&cc=5739|title=European Championship Qualifying Group B|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=2009-08-16}} He scored his first ever international goal against [[Latvia national football team|Latvia]] on 6 February 2008 in a friendly which Georgia lost 3–1.{{cite news|url=http://en.geofootball.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=313:georgia-1-3-latvia&catid=14&Itemid=100005|title=Georgia 1–3 Latvia|publisher=Geofootball.com|author=Lasha Chankvetadze|date=2008-02-09|accessdate=2009-06-28|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711084803/http://en.geofootball.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=313:georgia-1-3-latvia&catid=14&Itemid=100005|archive-date=11 July 2011|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} On 5 September 2009, Kaladze scored two [[own goal]]s in a [[2010 FIFA World Cup|2010 World Cup]] qualifying match against [[Italy national football team|Italy]] within the space of 11 minutes. The match ended 2–0 to Italy.{{cite news|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2009/09/05/soccer-world-georgia-idUKL528526320090905|title=Two Kaladze own goals give Italy win in Georgia|publisher=Reuters|date=2009-09-05|accessdate=2009-09-06}} Kaladze was the [[Captain (association football)|captain]] of the national team,{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/story/2008/09/04/kaladze-fifa-georgia.html|title=Georgian captain Kaladze at odds with FIFA|publisher=CBC|date=2008-09-04|accessdate=2009-07-08}} until 11 December 2011, when he announced his retirement.{{cite news|url=http://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/news/1085251/kaladze-quits-national-team|title=Kaladze quits national team|publisher=The World Game|date=2011-12-13|accessdate=2014-12-21}} The [[La Gazzetta dello Sport]] reporter and the president of [[:it:Association_internationale_de_la_presse_sportive|International Sports Press Association, AIPS]] [Italian], [[Gianni Merlo]] said: "Kakha Kaladze is a man of the history of [[Football in Georgia (country)|football in Georgia]]. In [[A.C. Milan|AC Milan]] he was a pillar of the [[Defender (association football)|defense]] and also a nice and polite man." {{Cite web|url=https://moffitor.wordpress.com/2013/06/01/aips-ის-პრეზიდენტმა-კალაძის-კ/|title=Gianni Merlo about Kakha Kaladze (interviewer Giorgi Dograshvili)|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} ===International goal=== :''Scores and results list Georgia's goal tally first.'' {| class="wikitable" style="margin:auto;" |- ! # !! Date !! Venue !! Opponent !! Score !! Result !! Competition |- | 1. || 6 February 2008 || [[Dinamo Arena|Boris Paichadze Stadium]], [[Tbilisi]] || {{fb|LAT}} || '''1'''–3 || 1–3 || [[Exhibition game#Association football|Friendly]] |} ==Personal life== In 2001, Kakha Kaladze's brother Levan, a [[Medicine|medical]] student, was [[Kidnapping|kidnapped]] in Georgia, with a [[ransom]] of $600,000 demanded.{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/kakha-kaladze-milan-bank-on-kaladze-steel-790527.html|title=Milan bank on Kaladze steel|publisher=''The Independent''|author=Frank Dunne|date=2008-03-03|accessdate=2009-06-28 | location=London}} [[President of Georgia|Georgia's president]] at the time, [[Eduard Shevardnadze]], promised that "everything is being done to locate him".{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/republic-of-ireland/2405710/Kidnap-mystery-worries-Kaladze.html|title=Kidnap mystery worries Kaladze|publisher=''The Telegraph''|date=2003-06-10|accessdate=2009-08-08|author=Christopher Davies | location=London}} Despite this assurance, the only time that Levan was ever seen was in a video where he was shown [[blindfold]]ed and begging for help.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2009/jul/30/kakha-kaladze-milan-gianluca-pessotto-juventus|title=Kakha Kaladze and Gianluca Pessotto's good news gives football perspective|publisher=''Guardian''|date=2009-07-30|accessdate=2009-08-17|author=Amy Lawrence | location=London}} Following the kidnapping, Kaladze threatened to take up Ukrainian citizenship, but reverted his decision, stating, "There was a time when I thought about quitting the national side completely, but I couldn't do it out of respect for the Georgian people and the fans who come and give us such support."{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/article1122295.ece|title=A Georgian nightmare|work=Times Online|author=Paul Rowan|date=2003-03-23|accessdate=2009-06-28 | location=London}} Roughly four years later, on 6 May 2005, Georgian [[police]] officers found eight dead bodies in the [[Svaneti]] region and it was speculated that Levan was among the dead.{{cite news|url=http://www.eurasianet.org/resource/georgia/hypermail/200506/0054.shtml|title=Former Georgian Prosecutor General Implicated in Failure to Solve Abduction Case |publisher=Eurasianet|date=2005-06-28|accessdate=2009-06-28 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070707182623/http://www.eurasianet.org/resource/georgia/hypermail/200506/0054.shtml |archivedate = 7 July 2007}}{{cite news|url=http://www.123football.com/players/k/kakha-kaladze/index.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060619143647/http://www.123football.com/players/k/kakha-kaladze/index.htm|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2006-06-19|title=123football.com – Kakha Kaladze|publisher=123football.com|accessdate=2009-06-28}} On 21 February 2006, Levan was officially identified among the deceased, after tests from [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] experts.{{cite news|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2007/03/06/soccer-europe-georgia-murder-idUKANT65386320070306|title=Two men jailed for killing Milan player's brother|publisher=Reuters|date=2007-03-06|accessdate=2009-06-29}} The local media claimed that the ransom was paid by Kaladze's family, although another source says that Kaladze's father attempted to meet the kidnappers, who fled as they believed he was followed by the police. Two men were sentenced to prison for the murder: David Asatiani for 25 years and Merab Amisulashvili for five years. On 14 July 2009, Kaladze's wife Anouki gave birth to their first-born son in Milan. The couple named their son Levan, in memory of Kaladze's brother.{{cite news|url=http://www.acmilan.com/en/news/show/87579|title=A Sweet Emotion|publisher=A.C. Milan|date=2009-07-15|accessdate=2012-01-05}} Kaladze has also been active in charitable causes and is a [[FIFA]] ambassador for the [[SOS Children's Villages]].{{cite news|url=http://www.sos-childrensvillages.org/News-and-Media/News/Pages/Kaladze-introduced-as-Georgias-FIFA-for-SOS-Childrens-Villages-ambassador.aspx|title=Kaladze introduced as Georgia's "FIFA for SOS Children's Villages" ambassador|publisher=SOS Kindendorf International|date=2006-01-18|accessdate=2009-06-29|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100617072511/http://www.sos-childrensvillages.org/News-and-Media/News/Pages/Kaladze-introduced-as-Georgias-FIFA-for-SOS-Childrens-Villages-ambassador.aspx|archivedate=17 June 2010|df=dmy-all}} Through his Kala Foundation,{{cite news|url=http://www.kalafoundation.it/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=54&Itemid=75|title=About Kala Foundation|publisher=Kalafoundation.it|accessdate=2009-08-08|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722040343/http://www.kalafoundation.it/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=54&Itemid=75|archivedate=2011-07-22}} a charitable organisation established in 2008, Kaladze raised €50,000 to benefit [[South Ossetia]]n refugees during the [[2008 Georgia–Russia crisis|Russian invasion of Georgia]].{{cite news|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/sport/2008/0906/1220629534122.html|title=Captain Kaladze looks to lift the gloom for Georgia|publisher=''Irish Times''|date=2008-09-06|accessdate=2009-08-08|author=Mary Hannigan}} Kaladze also plans to release an [[autobiography]] with the proceeds going to the Kala Foundation.{{cite news|url=http://georgiandaily.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=3822&Itemid=72|title=Kakha Kaladze aids Georgian football with Kala Foundation|publisher=''Georgian Daily''|date=2008-07-04|accessdate=2009-07-17|author=Natalie Mchedlishvili}} ==Political career== ===Business ventures=== Along with his football career, Kaladze is an investor in Georgia, Italy, [[Ukraine]] and [[Kazakhstan]].{{cite news|url=http://www.civil.ge/eng/article.php?id=17489|title=Ex-PM Chairs Soccer Star’s Business Group|publisher=Civil.ge|date=2008-03-31|accessdate=2009-06-29}} Kaladze owns Kala Capital, an investment company established in 2008 in Georgia with a focus on energy businesses,{{cite web|url=http://www.transparency.ge/en/post/general-announcement/possible-conflict-interests-kakha-kaladze|title=Possible conflict of interests of Kakha Kaladze|date=22 October 2012|publisher=Transparency International Georgia|accessdate=18 December 2017}} and whose chief executive is former Georgian Prime Minister [[Zurab Noghaideli]].{{cite web|url=http://jamestownfoundation.blogspot.com/2010/01/former-prime-minister-zurab-noghaideli.html|title=Jamestown Foundation Blog: Former Prime Minister Zurab Noghaideli: Putin’s New Pick for Georgia?|author=Jamestown Foundation|publisher=}} [[File:Richard B. Norland & Kakha Kaladze (Tskaltubo, 2012).jpg|thumb|right|Kaladze (right) with the [[United States Ambassador to Georgia]] [[Richard Norland]] (left) in 2012]] Kaladze's other businesses include the [[Buddha Bar]] in [[Kiev]] that opened in 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.buddhabar.com.ua/eng/buddabar/history|title=История лаунж-ресторана "Buddha-bar"|publisher=}}http://www.rooshvforum.com/thread-16987.html Kaladze is also the owner of a restaurant called Giannino, founded in 1899 by Giannino Bindi, which is based in Milan.{{cite news|url=http://www.ristorantegiannino.it/|title=Ristorante Giannino|publisher=Ristorantegiannino.it|accessdate=2009-08-17|language=Italian}}{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/2321763/Clubs-set-to-cash-in-from-Chelsea-exodus.html|title=Clubs set to cash in from Chelsea exodus|publisher=''The Telegraph''|date=2007-09-23|accessdate=2009-08-17 | location=London}} The restaurant has had a [[Michelin Guide|Michelin star]] under Davide Oldani and the chef in charge was Roberto Molinari.{{cite news|url=http://www.olmoantico.it/data/allegati/allegati/Corriere%20della%20Sera%20ed.Milano%20-%2005%20Giugno%202006%20-%20Continuazione%20Acanto.pdf}} url=http://www.chef-consultant.com {{cite news|url=http://ricerca.repubblica.it/repubblica/archivio/repubblica/2006/06/04/kaladze-fa-rinascere-giannino.html|title=Kaladze fa rinascere Giannino|publisher=''la Repubblica''|date=2006-06-04|accessdate=2009-08-17|language=Italian}} Kala Capital owned 45 percent of the Georgia Hydropower Construction Company company SakHidroEnergoMsheni, a joint stock company incorporated in Georgia in 1998.{{citation needed|date=January 2016}} His candidacy as [[Ministry of Energy and Natural Resources (Georgia)|Minister of Energy and Natural Resources]] in October 2012 was therefore overshadowed by concerns about a serious risk that a conflict of interests might arise.Statement by Transparency International Georgia http://transparency.ge/en/node/2472 Reports on the same day indicated that Kaladze might refuse the energy portfolio or sell off his shares in Georgia Hydropower Construction Company within 10 days of his appointment.http://greenalt.org/new/wp-content/uploads/2013/02/Kakha-Kaladze-Makes-a-Statement-on-a-Possible-Conflict-of-Interest.pdf ===Political office and conflict of interests=== Kaladze became involved in the politics of Georgia as a member of the opposition [[Georgian Dream–Democratic Georgia]] party founded by [[billionaire]] [[Bidzina Ivanishvili]] in February 2012. He was elected to the [[Parliament of Georgia]] on 1 October 2012. He was approved as Deputy Prime Minister as well as [[Ministry of Energy (Georgia)|Minister of Energy]] in the [[cabinet of Bidzina Ivanishvili]] on 25 October 2012. The appointment was met with skepticism in professional energy circles.{{cite web|url=http://oilprice.com/Energy/Energy-General/All-that-Glitters-is-Gold-for-Georgias-Sexy-New-Energy-Minister.html|title=All that Glitters is Gold for Georgia's Sexy New Energy Minister|date=17 October 2012|work=OilPrice.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/Environment/Energy-Voices/2012/1019/Georgia-installs-soccer-star-as-energy-minister|title=Georgia installs soccer star as energy minister|author=The Christian Science Monitor|date=19 October 2012|work=The Christian Science Monitor}} More importantly, it stirred an intense debate on a [[conflict of interest]] arising from Kaladze's business interests in the Georgia Hydropower Construction Company, in which Kala Capital owned 45 percent.{{cite web|url=http://eng.ghn.ge/news-6734.html|title=Kakha Kaladze owns the shares of "Sakhidromsheni" - News Agency - GHN|work=News Agency GHN}} Kala Capital sold the shares to GMC Group in November 2012 but concerns whether his indirect commercial interests had been abandoned remain.{{cite web|url=http://www.interpressnews.ge/en/economics/42012-process-of-selling-kakhi-kaladzes-shares-in-sakhidromsheni-is-over.html?ar=A|title=Process of Selling Kakhi Kaladze’s shares in "Sakhidromsheni" is Over - News Agency InterpressNews|work=interpressnews}} ===Mayor of Tbilisi=== In July 2017, Kaladze resigned as Energy minister in order to run for Tbilisi mayor in the upcoming local elections. On 22 October, he was elected mayor as a candidate of Georgian Dream, winning the elections with 51℅ of the votes. He was sworn in on 13 November 2017.{{cite news|last1=Antidze|first1=Margarita|title=Former soccer star Kaladze becomes mayor of Georgia's capital|url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-georgia-election/former-soccer-star-kaladze-becomes-mayor-of-georgias-capital-idUKKBN1CR0MU|accessdate=1 April 2018|publisher=Reuters|date=22 October 2017}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{cite news|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/player/_/id/11881/kakha-kaladze?cc=5739|title=Kakha Kaladze ESPN Profile|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=2009-10-04}} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%; width:75%;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:10%;"| Team ! rowspan="2" style="width:7%;"| Season ! colspan="2" style="width:10%;"| Domestic

A '''land contract''' — often described by [[#Other names|other terminology listed below]] — is a contract between the buyer and seller of [[real property]] in which the seller provides the buyer [[credit (finance)|financing]] in the purchase, and the buyer repays the resulting loan in [[Hire purchase|installments]]. Under a land contract, the seller retains the legal [[Title (property)|title]] to the property, while permitting the buyer to take possession of it for most purposes other than legal ownership. The sale price is typically paid in periodic installments, often with a [[balloon payment]] at the end to make the [[timelength]] of payments shorter than in the corresponding fully [[Amortization|amortized]] loan (i.e., a loan without a final balloon payment). When the full purchase price has been paid including any [[interest]], the seller is obligated to [[Conveyancing|convey]] (to the buyer) legal title to the property. An initial [[down payment]] from the buyer to the seller is usually also required.
The [[land contract law|legal status of land contracts]] varies between jurisdictions.{{vague|date= October 2016|reason = implausible that correlation between "region[s]" and "legal status[es]" is more than — well, let's call it "a vague" — tendency.}}
Since a land contract specifies the sale of a specific item of [[real estate]] between a seller and buyer, a land contract can be considered a special type of [[real estate contract]]. In the usual, more conventional real estate contracts, a seller does not provide a loan to the buyer; the contract either does not specify a loan or includes provisions for a loan from a different "third party" lender, usually a financial institution in practice. When third party lenders are involved, typically a [[lien]], as part of a [[Mortgage law|mortgage]] or [[trust deed (real estate)|trust deed]], is placed on the property, in which the property serves as [[collateral (finance)|collateral]] until the loan is repaid.
{{anchor|Other names}}Other terms for a land contract include: * terms contract<ref>[http://www.austlii.edu.au/au/legis/vic/consol_act/sola1962100/s29a.html SALE OF LAND ACT 1962 - Section 29A] (Vic, Australia)</ref> * contract for deed * agreement for deed * land installment contract * installment sale agreement
==Installment payments== It is common for the installment payments of the purchase price to be similar to mortgage payments in amount and effect. The amount is often determined according to a mortgage [[amortization schedule]]. In effect, each installment payment is partial payment of the purchase price and partial payment of interest on the unpaid purchase price. This is similar to mortgage payments which are part repayment of the principal amount of the mortgage loan and part interest. As the buyer pays more toward the principal of the loan over time, his(her) equity (equitable title or equitable interest) in the property increases. For example, if a buyer pays a $2000 down payment and borrows $8000 for a $10000 parcel of land, and pays off in installments another $4000 of this loan (not including interest), the buyer has $6000 of equity in the land (which is 60% of the equitable title), but the seller holds legal title to the land as recorded in documentation ([[deed]]s) in a government [[Recorder of deeds|recorder's office]] until the loan is completely paid off. However, if the buyer defaults on installment payments, the land contract may consider the failure to timely pay installments a [[breach of contract]] and the land equity may revert to the seller, depending on the land contract provisions.
Since land contracts can easily be written or modified by any seller or buyer; one may come across any variety of repayment plans. Interest only, [[negative amortization]]s, short balloons, extremely long amortizations just to name a few. It is not uncommon for land contracts to go unrecorded. For several reasons, the buyer or seller may decide that the contract is not to be recorded in the register of deeds. This does not make the contract invalid, but it does increase exposure to undesirable side effects. Some states, such as Minnesota, issue contracts without an [[acceleration clause]], which in the case of a default leaves the seller in a position to either cancel the contract, discharging any principal deficiency, as in the case of deprecation, or to litigate for 18 months or more while letting the buyer, if not a corporation, retain their rights to the property while collection attempts are made, by which time the buyer will often qualify for bankruptcy, making the contract, when lacking said [[acceleration clause]], effectively an installment option, when the buyer has no other lienable assets. In bankruptcy, some regions will interpret it as an [[executory contract]] that can be rejected, while others will treat it as a debt to be paid out of the bankruptcy trust. This and a wide variety of other legal ambiguities has led to a trend toward eliminating the use of Land Contracts to remove any incentives, and as a result, the disadvantages that these contracts have compared to the standard note and mortgage, which are more clearly defined in, and regulated by, law. <ref name="nature of contract">{{cite web|url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qa3736/is_199801/ai_n8759824/pg_19/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-05-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100912193027/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qa3736/is_199801/ai_n8759824/pg_19/ |archivedate=2010-09-12 |df= }}</ref>
==Reasons for a land contract== Although most land contracts can be used for a variety of reasons, their most common use is as a form of short-term seller financing. Usually, but not always, the date on which the full amount of the purchase price is due will be years sooner than when the purchase price would be paid in full according to the amortization schedule. This results in the final payment being a large [[balloon payment]]. Since the amount of the final payment is so large, the buyer may obtain a conventional mortgage loan from a bank to make the final payment. Land contracts are sometimes used by buyers who do not qualify for conventional mortgage loans offered by a traditional lending institution, for reasons of unestablished or poor credit or an insufficient down payment.{{Fact|date=November 2007}} Land contracts are also used when the seller is eager to sell and the buyer is not given enough time to arrange for conventional financing.
There can be other advantages of using a land contract too. When a third-party lender, such as a financial institution, provides a loan, this third party has its own interests to protect against the other two parties involved, the seller and buyer. Establishing the correct title and value of the property to be used as collateral is important to the lender. Thus, the lender commonly requires title service including title search and [[title insurance]] by an independent title company, [[Real estate appraisal|appraisal]] and termite inspection of the property to ensure it has sufficient value, a [[Cadastre|land survey]] to ensure there are no encroachments, and use of lawyers to ensure the [[closing (real estate)|closing]] is done correctly. These third party lender requirements add to [[closing costs]] which the lender requires the seller and/or buyer to pay. If the seller is also the lender, these costs are usually not required by the seller and may result in closing cost savings and fewer complications. It may also be the seller's position that if the buyer requires any of these services, he could pay for the costs and make arrangements himself. For properties where only relatively undeveloped land is involved and if the seller is willing to finance, the price of the empty land may be so low that the conventional closing costs are not worthwhile and can be an impediment to a quick, simple sale. Easy financing and a simple sale transaction may be a good selling point for a seller to offer a buyer.
A land contract is a unilateral contract and cannot be assigned to another buyer without the consent of the seller providing the financing.
== Consumer-protection concerns {{anchor|Concerns Growing}} == Because of growing concerns that sales via land contract might violate [[truth in lending]] laws, the [[Consumer Financial Protection Bureau]] (CFPB) is considering regulating these real estate sales.<ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/11/business/dealbook/contract-for-deed-lending-gets-federal-scrutiny.html</ref> In 2015, Texas law was changed to automatically place the legal title to the property with the buyer by filing the contract with the deed records office of the county where the property is located. While the seller loses title, the seller retains a vendor's lien in the property for the outstanding balance of the contract.<ref>http://www.edinburgpolitics.com/2015/06/01/protections-for-low-income-texas-homeowners-including-thousands-who-live-in-colonias-approved-by-the-legislature-says-rep-canales/</ref>

revision.text:
{{Infobox scientist | name = Larry Brilliant | image = Larry Brilliant.jpg.jpg | caption = | birth_name = Lawrence Brilliant | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1944|5|5}} | birth_place = [[Detroit, Michigan]], United States | field = [[Epidemiology]] | alma_mater = [[Master of Public Health|MPH]] - [[University of Michigan]]
[[Doctor of Medicine|M.D.]] - [[Wayne State University School of Medicine]] | known_for = One of the leaders of the successful [[World Health Organization]] (WHO) [[smallpox]] eradication program. }} '''[[The WELL|Lawrence]] "Larry" Brilliant''' (born May 5, 1944) is an American [[epidemiology|epidemiologist]], technologist, philanthropist, and author of "[http://www.larrybrilliant.com Sometimes Brilliant]." Brilliant, a technology patent holder, has been the CEO of public companies and venture backed start-ups. He was the inaugural Executive Director of [[Google.org]],{{cite news|last1=Goodell|first1=Jeff|title=The Guru of Google|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/news/from-the-issue-the-guru-of-google-20080404|publisher=Rolling Stone|date=April 2008}} the charitable arm of [[Google]] established in 2005, and the first CEO of [http://www.skollglobalthreats.org Skoll Global Threats Fund], established in 2009 by eBay founder [[Jeffrey Skoll|Jeff Skoll]] to address [[climate change]], [[Pandemic|pandemics]], [[water security]], [[nuclear proliferation]], and [[List of modern conflicts in the Middle East|conflict in the Middle East]]. Brilliant currently serves as the Chairman of the Board of [http://www.endingpandemics.org Ending Pandemics], and is also on the boards of the [[Skoll Foundation]], [http://www.salesforce.org Salesforce.org], [http://www.seva.org The Seva Foundation], and [http://www.dharma.ai Dharma Platform]. From 1973 to 1976, Brilliant participated in the successful [[World Health Organization]] (WHO) [[smallpox]] eradication program. ==Early life== Born in [[Detroit, Michigan]], Brilliant received his undergraduate training as well as his MPH degree (Masters in Public Health) from the [[University of Michigan]], where he worked on the staff of the [[Gargoyle Humor Magazine]], and his [[Doctor of Medicine|M.D.]] from [[Wayne State University School of Medicine]]. He moved to [[California]] for his [[internship]] at the [[California Pacific Medical Center]], and developed [[Parathyroid Cancer|parathyroid cancer]] from which he recovered. Brilliant is board certified in preventive medicine and public health. In 1969, a group of American Indians from many different tribes, calling themselves Indians of All Tribes, [[Occupation of Alcatraz|occupied the Alcatraz island]] in San Francisco. A call went out for doctors to help a pregnant woman there give birth and Brilliant joined their occupation as unofficial doctor.{{cite web| date = 24 February 2006| url = http://www.mindfully.org/Technology/2006/Larry-Brilliant-Technology24feb06.htm| title = Larry Brilliant: Doctor Looks to Use Technology to Aid Global Health Care| publisher = Wall Street Journal| accessdate = 2007-07-26| author = Hoge, Patrick| deadurl = yes| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20071101072602/http://www.mindfully.org/Technology/2006/Larry-Brilliant-Technology24feb06.htm| archivedate = 1 November 2007| df = }} ==Career== [[File:Larry Brilliant at Spotlight Health Aspen Ideas Festival 2015 - 1.JPG|thumb|right|Brilliant in 2015]] After the US government forced the Indians of All Tribes off Alcatraz, Brilliant became a media darling which led to a movie company casting him in ''Medicine Ball Caravan''—a sequel to the hit [[Woodstock Nation]]—playing a doctor in a film about a tribe of hippies who follow the [[Grateful Dead]], [[Jefferson Airplane]], [[Jethro Tull (band)|Jethro Tull]], and [[Joni Mitchell]].{{cite web| year = 2000| url = http://www.fastcompany.com/online/39/brilliant.html| title = Dr. Brilliant Vs. the Devil of Ambition| publisher = fastcompany.com| accessdate = 2007-07-26| last = Harriet Rubin| deadurl = yes| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070927231816/http://www.fastcompany.com/online/39/brilliant.html| archivedate = 2007-09-27| df = }} The cast was paid with airline tickets to [[India]]. Brilliant and some others cashed their tickets in and rented a bus to drive around Europe, which then turned into a relief convoy to help victims of the [[1970 Bhola cyclone|1970 Bhola cyclone in Bangladesh]] (then East Pakistan). Civil unrest stopped the relief caravan so he spent several years in India studying at a [[Himalayas|Himalayan]] [[ashram]] with [[Neem Karoli Baba]] (a [[Hindu]] sage) from whom he received the name Subramanyum. After about a year [[Neem Karoli Baba]] advised Brilliant to eradicate [[smallpox]], a project on which he would spend the next several years. He participated, as a medical officer, in the [[World Health Organization]] (WHO) [[smallpox]] eradication program that in 1980 certified the global eradication of smallpox.{{cite web|year=2000 |url=http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/smallpox/en/ |title=Smallpox |accessdate=2007-07-26 |publisher=[[World Health Organization|WHO]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070921235036/http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/smallpox/en/ |archivedate=2007-09-21 |df= }} Brilliant found that Indian officials became more receptive to his efforts when they learned of Neem Karoli Baba's involvement, to which he credits a significant portion of the program's success.Ram Dass (1995). ''Miracle of Love: Stories about Neem Karoli Baba''. Hanuman Foundation. 4th ed., [http://hanumanfdn.org/pdfs/MoL-TheStick.pdf Chapter 9: The Stick That Heals], pp. 155-161. {{ISBN|978-1-887474-00-9}}. Brilliant contributed a seven-page account of his experiences to the book ''Miracle of Love: Stories of Neem Karoli Baba''. In December 1978, he became a co-founder and chairman of [[Seva Foundation]], an international, non-profit, health foundation. Seva's projects in places like [[Tibet]], [[Nepal]], [[India]], [[Bangladesh]], [[Cambodia]], [[Tanzania]], [[Ethiopia]], and [[Guatemala]] have given back sight to more than 3 million blind people through surgery, self-sufficient eye care systems, and low cost manufacturing of [[intraocular lense]]s. One important contribution of his was his helping to set up the [[Aravind Eye Hospital]] in [[Madurai]], India.{{citation needed|date=December 2012}} When he returned to the United States, he became a professor of international health at the [[University of Michigan]] as well as starting numerous charitable and business ventures. In 1985, he co-founded, with [[Stewart Brand]], [[WELL (virtual community)|The Well]], a prototypic [[online community]] that has been the subject of multiple books and studies. ''Time magazine'' said, "Well was a huge hit, a precursor of every online business from Amazon.com to eBay."{{cite web |date= April 21, 2003| url = http://www.time.com/time/printout/0,8816,1004713,00.html| title = Will You Buy WiFi?| publisher = [[Time (magazine)|TIME]]| accessdate = 2007-07-26 | author=Taylor, Chris}} He spent the first half of 2005 as a volunteer helping out in [[2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami|the tsunami]] in [[Sri Lanka]] and working in India with WHO in the campaign to eradicate [[polio]]. On February 22, 2006, [[Google|Google Inc.]] appointed him as the Executive Director of [[Google.org]], the philanthropic arm of Google,{{cite web |date=September 14, 2006| url = https://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/14/technology/14google.html?ei=5090&en=56861c8f4ca9b3e7&ex=1315886400&adxnnl=1&partner=rssuserland&emc=rss&adxnnlx=1185372545-ivq5NRvaEOg4wFTGfEZP9Q| title = Philanthropy Google’s Way: Not the Usual |work=NY Times |accessdate = 2007-07-25 | author=Hafner, Katie}} a position which he held until April, 2009,{{cite web |date=April 14, 2009| url= http://blog.google.org/2009/04/brilliant-takes-on-urgent-threats.html| title = Brilliant Takes on Urgent Threats| publisher = Google |accessdate = 2009-06-25 | author=Dr. Larry Brilliant}} when he joined the Skoll Foundation, as its President, the philanthropic organization established by former eBay president Jeff Skoll.{{cite news |title=Google loses Brilliant to rival foundation |url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/blog/2009/apr/15/google-org-larry-brilliant |publisher=The Guardian |date=15 April 2009 |accessdate=}} In July 2006, he was awarded the [[TED Prize]], granting him $100,000 and 'One Wish to Change the World'{{cite web | author = Zetter, Kim | url = https://www.wired.com/news/technology/0,70280-0.html |title = Brilliant's Wish: Disease Alerts |publisher = Wired.com | date = 2006-02-23 | accessdate = 2007-08-01}} which he presented at TED in July 2006. As his prize nominator summed up, "'Dr. Brilliant' is a name to live up to, and he has."{{cite web |date=July 2006 | url = https://www.ted.com/talks/larry_brilliant_wants_to_stop_pandemics| title = Larry Brilliant: TED Prize wish: Help stop the next pandemic| format = Streaming Video| publisher = [[TED (conference)]]| accessdate = 2007-07-25 }} His one wish that he presented at the conference was, "To build a powerful new early warning system to protect our world from some of its worst nightmares."{{cite web |date=March 23, 2006| url = http://giussani.typepad.com/loip/2006/03/can_the_interne.html| title = Larry Brilliant: Can the Internet help stop pandemics?| publisher = LunchoverIP| accessdate = 2007-07-25 | last=Bruno Giussani }} In May 2013, he gave the commencement speech at [[Harvard School of Public Health]], {{quote|On Nov. 5, 1962, the Reverend Martin Luther King visited the University of Michigan. It was a dramatic time. The world teetered on the brink of nuclear madness during the Cuban Missile Crisis. Federal troops were on patrol after the first black student was admitted to Ole Miss. ... He said that "the arc of moral universe is long, but it bends towards justice". ... Here is what I ask of you: Imagine that arc of history that Martin Luther King inspired is right here with us. The arc of the universe needs your help to bend it towards justice. It will not happen on its own. The arc of history will not bend towards justice without you bending it. Public health needs you to insure health for all. Seize that history. Bend that arc. I want you to leap up, to jump up and grab that arc of history with both hands, and yank it down, twist it, and bend it. Bend it towards fairness, bend it towards better health for all, bend it towards justice!{{cite web| title = " HSPH News " Commencement 2013: Larry Brilliant’s address|publisher=Harvard School of Public Health| url = http://www.hsph.harvard.edu/news/features/commencement-2013-larry-brilliants-address/ |date=May 30, 2013| accessdate = 2013-11-22}}}} ==Personal life== Brilliant is married to Girija (formerly Elaine) and has three children: Joe, Jon, and Iris Brilliant. Girija holds a PhD in public health administration and is an equal partner in many of her husband's enterprises. Co-founder of [[Seva Foundation]],[http://www.seva.org/site/PageServer?pagename=about_history Seva Foundation: History] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140106192001/http://www.seva.org/site/PageServer?pagename=about_history |date=2014-01-06 }} she was instrumental in the [[World Health Organization]]'s smallpox eradication program. ==Film== Brilliant has worked on numerous films including ''[[Contagion (film)|Contagion]]'', ''[http://unseenenemies.com/ Unseen Enemies]'', the award winning HBO film ''[http://www.vermilionpictures.com/openyoureyes/ Open Your Eyes]'' (as producer), ''[[Saint Misbehavin': The Wavy Gravy Movie|Saint Mis’Behaving]] (''about his friend, the clown, Wavy Gravy''), [http://www.pbs.org/independentlens/ramdass/film.html Fierce Grace]'', the CNN film ''[https://www.cnn.com/shows/unseen-enemy Unseen Enemy]'', ''Medicine Ball Caravan'', ''[[Hare Rama Hare Krishna (1971 film)|Hare Rama Hare Krishna]]'', and Oscar nominated ''[[The Final Inch]].'' Brilliant also acted as an extra in the 1971 [[Bollywood]] movie ''[[Hare Rama Hare Krishna (1971 film)|Hare Rama Hare Krishna]]'', which depicts [[hippie]] culture. He said, "When shooting for the song sequence '[[Dum Maro Dum (song)|Dum Maro Dum]]' (which glorifies smoking marijuana), [[Dev Anand]] was looking for certain types of foreigners..."{{cite web|url=http://www.prabhupada.org/rama/?p=3394#more-3394|title=Executive Director of Google praising the Ramayana and Mahabharata!|date=2008-05-21|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071025071105/http://www.prabhupada.org/rama/?p=3394#more-3394|archivedate=2007-10-25|deadurl=yes|df=}} Brilliant is a featured interviewee in the 2009 feature-length documentary, ''[[Saint Misbehavin': The Wavy Gravy Movie]]'', as the social activist's real-life physician. ==Writings== * ''Sometimes Brilliant'', [[HarperOne]][https://www.harpercollins.com/9780062049230/sometimes-brilliant] * {{cite book |chapter=Were you talking to God? |first=Larry |last=Brilliant |editor=Ram Dass |title=Miracle of Love: Stories about Neem Karoli Baba |chapterurl = http://www.ramdass.org/were-you-talking-to-god/ |publisher=Hanuman Foundation |edition=3rd |year=1995 |isbn=1887474005}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{commonscat|Larry Brilliant}} * [http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p00fvly5 Are Social Entrepreneurs Heroes?] Larry Brilliant on [http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p004kln9 BBC The Forum] * {{Twitter}} * [http://www.seva.org/ Seva Foundation (Co-Founder)] * [http://www.skollfoundation.org/staff/larry-brilliant/ Larry Brilliant, President, Skoll Global Threats Fund, Profile] at Skoll Foundation * {{TED speaker}} ** {{TED talk|larry_brilliant_wants_to_stop_pandemics|TED Prize Wish: Larry Brilliant wants to stop pandemics}} (TED2006) ** {{TED talk|larry_brilliant_makes_the_case_for_optimism|Larry Brilliant makes the case for optimism}} (Skoll World Forum 2007) {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Brilliant, Larry}} [[Category:1944 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American public health doctors]] [[Category:World Health Organization officials]] [[Category:Google employees]] [[Category:American humanitarians]] [[Category:American philanthropists]] [[Category:American businesspeople]] [[Category:University of Michigan alumni]] [[Category:Wayne State University School of Medicine alumni]] [[Category:Physicians from Detroit]] [[Category:American officials of the United Nations]]

[[File:CourtGavel.JPG|thumb|right|250px]] '''Legal management''' (also offered as: legal studies, or paralegal studies) is an [[academic]] and [[professional]] discipline that is a hybrid between the study of [[law]] and [[management]] (i.e. business administration, public administration, etc.). It is generally considered as the best preparatory law program for those who aspire to become members of a [[Bar (law)|bar]].<ref>{{cite web|title=BS Legal Management|url=http://www.finduniversity.ph/majors/bs-in-legal-management-philippines/}}</ref> Often, alumni of legal management programmes pursue a [[professional degree]] in law such as [[Juris Doctor]] (JD) or [[Bachelor of Laws]] (Ll.B.) while some profess as [[paralegals]], law clerks, political analysts, politicians, public administrators, entrepreneurs, business executives, or pursue careers in the [[academe]].
The degree was designed in the [[Philippines]] and was first introduced in [[Ateneo de Manila University]] in the 1980s by former [[Philippine Supreme Court]] [[Chief Justice]] [[Renato Corona]]. It is also offered in the United States,<ref>http://nationalparalegal.edu/Bachelors.aspx</ref> most notably, at the [[University of California Berkeley]].<ref>http://legalstudies.berkeley.edu/</ref>
Legal management student organisations across the Philippines are represented by the Alliance of Legal Management Associations of the Philippines (ALMAP) to the [[Securities and Exchange Commission]], as a [[non-stock]], [[non-profit]], student-run corporation. Timothy Caday is the national president of ALMAP for the academic year 2017-2018.
==Curriculum== Legal management is currently offered in multiple degree formats depending on the offering [[college]] or [[university]]. Its variety and flexibility is a focal point among schools that have it in their roster of [[academic degrees]]. Some capitalise in the [[legal]] aspects, while others for the [[business]] aspects. Some schools may offer the degree either as a predominantly preparatory law programme, a [[liberal arts]] focused programme, or a business and [[management]] programme. Core subjects include: [[law]], [[philosophy]], [[literature]] and [[management]] (public and business). Depending on the school, the ratio of law courses to management courses vary between 40:60 to 90:10. Graduate degrees in the discipline are offered in multiple colleges and universities in the United States.
Variations of the discipline can be conferred either as the following undergraduate degrees: * [[Bachelor of Science]] in Legal Management (BSc Legal Management) * [[Bachelor of Arts]] in Legal Management (AB Legal Management) * [[Bachelor of Arts]] in Legal Studies (AB Legal Studies) * [[Bachelor of Arts]] in Paralegal Studies (AB Paralegal Studies) * [[Bachelor of Science]] in [[Business Administration]] major in Legal Management (BSc BA Legal Management) * [[Bachelor of Science]] in [[Management]] major in Legal Management (BSc Management - Legal Management)
===Courses=== Legal management alumni are highly trained, adept, and knowledgeable in the following gamut of disciplines:
{{refbegin}} {| class="wikitable" |- !'''Liberal Arts''' !'''Law''' !'''Business''' |- | * Anthropology * Communication Arts * Governance and Public Administration * History * Literature * Philosophy * Psychology * Political Economy * Political Science * Public Policy * Sociology | * Administrative Law * Civil Law * Constitutional Law * Criminal Law * Labour Law * Legal and Judicial Ethics * Legal Writing and Statutory Construction * Mercantile Law * Remedial Law * Taxation Law * Political Law * Public International Law | * Accounting * Business Mathematics * Business Communication * Corporate Social Responsibility * Economics * Finance * Marketing * Human Resource Management * Statistics * Organisational Behaviour * Operations Management * Public Relations * Strategic Management * Taxation * Total Quality Management
|} {{refend}}
==Alliance of Legal Management Associations of the Philippines== Founded in 2000, the Alliance of Legal Management Associations of the Philippines (ALMAP, Inc.) is the home of all Legal Management Student Organisations in the Philippines. It is responsible for the promotion of all Legal Management Degree Programs in the country, and is the sole and exclusive representative of the Legal Management Student Body in the [[Commission on Higher Education (Philippines)|Commission on Higher Education]] (CHED) and it is duly registered with the [[Securities and Exchange Commission]] as a Non-Stock, [[Non-Profit]] Student Organisation.
It fosters relationships between different schools offering the Legal Management, Legal Studies, Paralegal Studies, and the like degree programs through social engineering projects, forums, academic seminars, project partnerships and nation-building initiatives.

page.title: List of airline bankruptcies in the United States

revision.text: {{Use mdy dates|date=November 2011}} A number of major airlines have declared [[bankruptcy]] and have either ceased operations, or reorganized under [[reorganization|bankruptcy protection]]. Airlines, like any business, are susceptible to market fluctuations and economic difficulties. The economic structure of the airline industry may contribute to airline bankruptcies as well. One major element in almost every airline bankruptcy is the rejection by the debtor of its current collective bargaining agreements with employees. After satisfying certain requirements, bankruptcy law permits courts to approve rejection of labor contracts by the debtor-employer. With this tool, airline managers reduce costs. Terms of an employee contract negotiated over years can be eliminated in months through Chapter 11. Terms of the Railway Labor Act, amended in 1936 to cover airlines, prevent most labor union work actions before, during and after an airline bankruptcy. == Timeline == This is a timeline of [[airline]]s who have filed for bankruptcy protection. Also see [[list of defunct airlines]] for a list of airlines which are no longer operating. === U.S. airlines bankruptcy filings === ====Chapter 7==== This is a list of airlines that have filed for bankruptcy protection via [[Chapter 7, Title 11, United States Code|Chapter 7]] in the United States.{{cite news|title=List of Airline Bankruptcies Since Deregulation|url=http://www.boston.com/business/articles/2011/11/29/american_joins_long_list_of_airline_bankruptcies/|accessdate=23 May 2012|newspaper=Associated Press|date=Nov 29, 2011}}{{Cite web|url=http://airlines.org/data/u-s-bankruptcies-and-services-cessations/|title=Airlines For America {{!}} U.S. Bankruptcies and Services Cessations|website=airlines.org|access-date=2016-05-12|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160528074046/http://airlines.org/data/u-s-bankruptcies-and-services-cessations/|archivedate=May 28, 2016|df=mdy-all}} {|class="wikitable" border="1" |- !Airline !Date Bankruptcy filed |- |[[National Florida Airlines]]National Florida Airlines - Sunshine Skies. revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=April 2014}} The '''Master of Accountancy''' ('''M.Acc.''' or '''M.Acy.'''), alternatively '''Master of Science in Accountancy''' ('''M.S.Acy.''') or '''Master of Professional Accountancy''' ('''M.P.Acy.''') is a graduate [[professional degree]] designed to prepare students for public accounting and to provide them with the 150 credit hours of classroom, but mostly clinical hours, required by most states before taking the [[Uniform Certified Public Accountant Examination]].
Similar graduate programs exist in [[Canada]], where certain [[universities in Canada|universities]] such as [[University of Waterloo]]'s [[University of Waterloo School of Accounting and Finance|School of Accounting and Finance]], or [[Carleton University]]'s [[Sprott School of Business]], offer the MAcc and waive all education requirements up until the [[Uniform Evaluation|Common Final Examination]] (CFE) in order to become a [[Chartered Professional Accountant|Canadian CPA]].
A Master of Professional Accounting can also be obtained from [[Australia|Australian]] universities to qualify for the [[CPA Australia|Australian CPA]], [[Institute of Public Accountants|IPA]] or [[Institute of Chartered Accountants in Australia|CA]].
This specialty program usually runs one to two years in length and contains from ten to twelve three semester credit courses (30 to 36 semester hours total). The program may consist of all graduate accounting courses or a combination of graduate accounting courses, graduate management, tax, leadership and other graduate business electives. The program is designed to not only prepare students for the CPA examination but also to provide a strong knowledge of accounting principles and business applications.
Graduates entering corporate accounting or [[consulting firm|consulting]] often additionally (alternatively) pursue the [[Certified Management Accountant]] (CMA), [[Certified Internal Auditor]] (CIA) or other certifications.
Note that in other countries, the degree's purpose may differ. Where the [[Bachelor of Accountancy]] is the prerequisite for professional practice, for example in [[South Africa]], the Master of Accountancy then comprises specialized [[coursework]] in a [[Accounting#Topics|specific area of accountancy]] ([[Computer-aided audit tools|computer auditing]], taxation...), as opposed to CPA preparation as above. It may also be offered as a research based program,<ref> For example: [http://econ.ufs.ac.za/content.aspx?id=176 Free State University] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141129153153/http://econ.ufs.ac.za/content.aspx?id=176 |date=2014-11-29 }}, [http://academic.sun.ac.za/accounting/prospective.html Stellenbosch University], [http://www.unisa.ac.za/qualificationsMD/index.asp?link=http://www.unisa.ac.za/qualificationsMD/qualifications/98656.html UNISA] .</ref> granting access to doctoral programs.
==See also== *[[Bachelor of Accountancy]] *[[Certified Public Accountant]] *[[Chartered Professional Accountant]] *[[Enrolled Agent]] – Recognition to represent taxpayers with the [[Internal Revenue Service|IRS]] *[[Master of Laws]] – LL.M. in Tax is an advanced law degree *[[Master of Science in Taxation]] – A similar, but more specialized, course of work
==References== {{reflist|2}}
{{academic degrees}}
